general_advisory: According to the weather forecast, the district is likely to receive light to moderate rain up to Tuesday with generally to cloudy sky. The wind speed is likely to remain within 05.0 to 10.0 kmph for the next five days. The daily maximum and minimum temperature may range between 31.0°C to 35.0°C and 24.0°C to 25.0°C respectively. Relative humidity during the morning and afternoon may range between 90 to 95 percent and 67 to 76 percent respectively. Farmers are advised to withhold application of fertilizers and plant protection chemicals for the time being. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to crop’s growth stage. Avoid excess nitrogen as it promotes excessive vegetative growth and increases water demand.

advisory: To manage the fall army worm pest, spray biopesticide Beauveria bassiana @ 1200-gram/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water. Use 10-12 bird perches per acre and remove them before tasselling stage. Dust mixture of sand, soil, and wooden ash inside the leaf whorl so that the caterpillars cannot feed on the leaves. To manage the pest chemically, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5 % S.G @ 80-gram/acre or Spinetoram 11.7% S.C @ 100-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80-ml/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water.

To manage Blast disease, spray Hexaconazole 5 % SC @ 400-ml/acre or Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4 % S.C @ 200-ml/acre or Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrobin 25 % WG @ 80-gram/acre. To manage Leaf Folder and Case Worm pests in paddy spray Bifenthrin 10% EC @ 200 ml/acre or Lambda Cyhalothrin 5% EC @ 200-ml/acre or Fipronil 5% SC @ 400-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60-ml /acre.

Pink stem borer management in fingermillet crop: Early transplant the seedlings. Remove and destroy affected bushes. Plant light traps and pheromone traps per acre. Plant 'T' shaped sticks per acre so that the birds can sit on them and eat the twigs climbing up the tree. Use Trichogramma chilonis card at weekly interval. Along with this spray Bacillus thiringenesis or Metarhizium anisopilae. Mix Handi-khata extract with water and spray once a week. Mix Nimastra with Brahmastra extract and spray 30 days after planting.

Due to high temperature and humidity, there are reports of incidence of sucking pest like Aphids and Jassids in Cotton crop. Go for regular monitoring of the crop for incidence of pest and diseases. If there is infestation of sucking pest like Aphids and Jassids, cotton crop go for spraying of neem-based pesticide (Neem Oil 1500 PPM) by mixing it in water. Use yellow sticky trap. If the sucking pest population found to be above ETL, spray Flonicamid 50% WG or Thiamethoxam 25% WG or Dinotefuran 20 % SG.

In prevailing weather condition infestation of Mealy bug may be observed. If symptoms are seen, spray neem bases pesticide Azadiractin (1500 ppm) at initial stage of infestation. In case of severe infestation, spray Profenophos 50% EC or Thiamethoxam 25 WG or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL by mixing with water.

Brinjal is at flowering to fruiting stage. After receding of rainfall and there is chance of increasing in day & night temperature and morning relative humidity more than 70% favors Shoot and fruit borer in Brinjal. To manage the pest, remove the affected terminal shoot showing bore holes and the affected fruits. To manage this insect, install pheromone trap. Use chemical control if there is 4% withering of terminal shoot or 14% fruits infested with borers. For chemical control, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC or Spinetoram 11.7 % SC. There should be a gap of 7-10 days between pesticide application and harvest.
As grasses are high in moisture content during rainy days, the cattle don’t get adequate dry matter from those. So, give concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals.

After stocking of Fingerling, groundnut oil cake and rice bran at 1:1 ratio as feed given 5% of their body weight twice a day. Add vitamine and mineral mixture 1% of the total feed given to the fish. Regularly check the pH and water temperature after stocking the fingerling. Add lime per acre to purify the pond water. To increase the amount of plankton in the pond, apply cow dung and super phosphate per acre twice a month.

Bird flu is a viral disease of poultry. It spreads through contaminated feathers, saliva, droppings of birds. During this time please clean poultry houses every day and change the feed and water of poultry birds frequently. Don’t throw the dead poultry birds here and there. Please bury them by wearing gloves and masks and sanitize the place with bleaching powder. Don’t bring poultry birds or eggs to home from the affected area.
